name: From Ache to Zeke Trivia Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.explanation:
antique.

	Or antileak.

boutique.

	Or beak, bake, Batik, Blake, bleak, or break.

clique.

	Or creek, cake, or chic.

drake.

	What are female ducks called, 'ducks'?

questions.text: To get with difficulty, as in '_______ out a living'?
questions.explanation:
eke.

	Or eek! A mouse!

fake.

	Or freak or flake.

Greek.

	Or geek.
hake.

questions.text: The opening through which fluid enters, as in '_______ valve'?
questions.explanation: intake.

Jake.

	Jake Barnes from 'The Sun Also Rises.'

keek.

	I'd never heard of keeking, but perhaps baby chicks do it.

leak.

	Or lake or Lalique crystal.

meek.

	Or make, mystique, Monique, or Malik (male nurse on the hospital show ER).

questions.text: It's best to commute at _______ hours.
questions.explanation:
nonpeak.

	Or Newsweek or Newspeak (from Orwell's '1984').

opaque.

	Or outtake.

pique.

	Or peek or peak.

quake.

	Or Queek might be a good duckling name.

questions.text: Jane Austen's Willoughby was one, and so was her Henry Crawford. So was Richardson's Lovelace. So was Don Juan.
questions.explanation:
rake.

	Or reek.

sheik & sheikh.

	Or seek, sleek, squeak, sake, shake, slake, or spake (as in 'Thus ______ Zarathustra').

questions.text: Yellowish brown wood from an Indian timber tree?
questions.explanation:
teak.

	Or take or tweak.

unique.

	Or unmake.

Veronique.

	I knew an art director named Veronique Viennes. Do English people sometimes shorten the word 'vacation' to 'vake'? (One British player says no--one says "go on holiday," never "vacation" or "vake." However, I thought I heard it on a British TV show once.)

wake.

	Or week or weak.

questions.text: I'm skipping X and cheating on Y. Let's switch briefly to the long O plus K sound: The yellow part of an egg?
questions.explanation:
yolk.

	Or yoke. There is a firm called Yake and Associates which was founded by a Thomas Yake. They're at yake.com if you need their services.

Zeke & Zeek.

	If you liked this one, please take more of my A-Z quizzes under Humanities under English under Vocabulary under A-Z Words. Thanks!
